tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: ** ***** ****** ** *** **** ************* I can say this with some authority as we have lived in multiple cities in multiple countries and hence had to have a pediatrician in each place for our kids. Dr Sagar Sharma is the kindest, most patient of them all. He is also highly knowledgeable. He truly cares for the children. My baby has separation anxiety but he still easily goes to Dr Sagar. I think it's because doctor is always calm and cheerful. He answers all our questions and understands our worries. He never brushes off new parents concerns and patiently explains everything. I highly recommend Dr Sagar Sharma to all parents of little ones.

tags: None
review: Doctor was nice and handled baby very well. But the Srujana hospital Receptionist was too arrogant and was answering very rudely. I heard the same opinion from other people waiting there as well.  Also, when the transaction got cancelled while making payment she acted as though I have ran away from hospital without making payment. But the fault was with the connection they had in the swiping machine. I suggest to have a good receptionist so that doctor as well as Srujana hospital will not loose its customers/patients.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Experience with doctor was very good. However, the experience with billing counter/receptionist was really bad due to her un welcomingbehaviour. Firstly, she insisted on token to queue management - good. But she started putting people ahead of us without token. When I objected , she tried to cover up with manufactured story. Probably my last visit here :(

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
After our first consultation with Prashanth P which we were not at all satisfied, we decided to change the doctor and go to doctor Sagar Sharma at Motherhood hospital. 
He was very attentive when we were taking to the doctor as this is our first baby and we had a lot of questions to ask. He answered all of our questions very patiently and made us feel a lot better about the care we are giving our baby. 
Would recommend him definitely.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: I am showing both of my daughters to Dr. Sagar sharma. He explains the problem very patiently. Don't hurry in giving medicines. Gives assurance that the health of the kid shall be OK. Spares sufficient amount of time. Suggests natural remedies instead of medicines. Highly recommend.

tags: None
review:
True to all the reviews I read before going, the doctor is very courteous and patient. Has the rare ability to put parents at ease while explaining what needs to be done. Prescribes only the very essential medication. 
We are Very happy with the interaction.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I took my 4 yr old kid to see the doctor for severe cough and fever. The doctor prescribed a cough syrup, but failed to mention that it’s for paediatric use. ** *** ** ***** *** ********** ** *** ******** ****** *** *** ***** **** ***** **** ***** ******* ** *** ************ ** * * ** **** **** ** *** ***** ** *** ******* *** ********** Will never be going back to Srujana hospital or to Dr Sagar Sharma. Horrible experience!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Dr Sagar is such a nice person, the politeness, the smiling a face and the way he handles the kids are his unique qualities. As parents we feel that once we consult Sagar the kids should be fine and it's true. He prescribes what is good for the kids and never given anything that would temporarily arrests the situation and leads to side effects. ** ** *** ** **** ************** ** **** *****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Well experienced doctor, always suggests less medicine. Explains issues and remedies very patiently.  Handles babies happily with a friendly nature. We have visited him many times for my baby for both illness and vaccination . each and Everytime we have felt satisfied for consulting him.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Dr. Sagar is a very experienced doctor, and he put my baby at ease immediately. He was gentle with my baby during the check up. Dr. Sagar explained the issue and the steps to resolve it very patiently and also answered all my queries.
I would definitely recommend Dr. Sagar for new parents in and around electronic city.

review:
We are actually new to Bangalore and did not have any clues on choosing a right hospital/pediatrician.Then I went to Motherhood hospital and met Sagar Sharma, * ***** *** ** ** *** ***** He listens to Ur concern and explains everything neat&crisp. My daughter suffered from lactose intolerance *** ***** * **** *** ** *** ********** *** ********* ****** **** ********
He is very humble,friendly in nature and a perfect care taker. 

"A good doctors comfort and reassuring words are sometimes more powerful than medicines" :)

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Doctor Sagar is frank, professional and most importantly available and reachable. He has been very helpful right from the birth of my baby till now when he is 6 months old. For every petty issue, he has taken out time to resolve the issue and suggest some really good stuffs. I appreciate his love for his job and kind behavior to the fresh and worried parents like us. Thank you Doctor.
Regards,
Amit & Doris

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Dr. Sagar Sharma has lot of patience to explain every minute details of the problem, that we are seeking treatment for. He is very frank, when it comes to suggesting the medicine. ** ****** ******* *** **** ******** even though its much cheaper than costly medicines available in the pharmacy.

For my newborn, he suggested to use natural moisturizers and vaccinations which are more effective, than the costly, painless vaccinations respectively.
